title: Otumfuo Lauds Unibank
text:
1 October 2015 15:27 CET Otumfuo Lauds Unibank By Daily Guide 
Nana Okofo Sobin Kan II and other officials witnessing the 360 mini-draw in Kumasi 
The Asantehene Otumfuo Osei Tutu II has showered praises on Unibank for continually coming out with new and better programmes to boost the finances of its customers. 
He expressed happiness with the efforts of the management of Unibank to financially reward their customers. 
Otumfuo Osei Tutu II, in a speech read on his behalf by the Adansi Dopoasehene, Nana Okofo Sobin Kan II, urged Unibank to sustain its good works, urging other financial institutions to emulate the bank's shining example. 
He tasked financial institutions in the country to make the welfare of their customers their major priority, stressing that the good works of the banks would motivate people to save and do business with the banks. 
He disclosed this during Unibank's second mini draw of the 'Super 360 Promo' held in Kumasi, the Ashanti regional capital, to transform the lives of Unibank's customers across the country. 
Unibank customers won attractive prizes, including an amount of GH¢15,000, solar panels, washing machines, solar powered inverter systems and smart phones. 
Customers of Unibank were required to maintain GH¢200 or multiples to stand the chance of winning mouthwatering prizes from Unibank, including a staggering GH¢360,000 in the 'Super 360 Promo.' 
Clifford Mettle, Unibank's Director of E-Banking, Products and Marketing, said Unibank launched its fourth deposit mobilization promotion dubbed, 'Super 360 Promo in July 2015 to show appreciation to their loyal customers. 
He described Unibank as a caring bank which has the supreme interest of its customers at heart, citing the 'Dream and Drive' and 'Let's go to Brazil as some of the promotions of the bank to boost their lives. 
Mr. Mettle said the 'Super 360' Promo provides a unique opportunity for all to fairly win prizes in three months.' 
FROM I.F. Joe Awuah Jnr., Kumasi
